title: Indonesia Grants Zero Tariff to 99% of US Imports, Excluding Alcohol and Pork
body: Of the 11,552 tariff lines under Indonesia’s harmonized system (HS), approximately 11,474 have been agreed upon for tariff elimination.

title: Indonesia to Begin Energy Imports from US Following Tariff Deal, Minister Confirms
body: Under the agreement, Indonesia plans to import liquefied petroleum gas (LPG), crude oil, and refined fuel products from the United States.

title: Indonesia Pushes for Tariff Exemptions on Palm Oil, Coffee Exports to US
body: Indonesia seeks zero tariffs for key exports to the US while keeping some US goods taxed. US exports to Indonesia hit $10.2B in 2024.

title: Indonesia Unveils Strategy to Help MSMEs Survive After Granting 0% Tariff on US Goods
body: Jakarta has agreed to let American goods enter its market duty-free in exchange for a lower 19 percent tariff on US-bound Indonesian goods.

title: VinFast to Introduce New Model during Indonesia Auto Show
body: In just over a year since its official market entry in Indonesia, VinFast has expanded the dealership network to 24 showrooms.

title: Indonesia to Remain Top Palm Oil Supplier for US Thanks to Tariff Deal
body: Indonesia is set to maintain its dominance in the American palm oil market after the US sets its tariff on Jakarta at 19 percent.

title: Indonesia's $15 Billion US Energy Import Can Backfire, Analyst Warns
body: The major oil purchase deal with the US can worsen Jakarta's oil trade deficit and add pressure on government spending, analyst says.

title: Indonesian Business Leaders Applaud US Tariff Reduction Deal
body: Kadin welcomes the US tariff cut on Indonesian goods to 19%, calling it a chance to double trade despite global trade challenges.

title: US Tariffs on Indonesia Drop to 19%, Among The Lowest in Southeast Asia
body: The US will cut tariffs on Indonesian goods to 19% under a Prabowo-Trump deal, the lowest in ASEAN, giving RI an edge over Vietnam.

title: ‘Garuda Needs New Planes’: Prabowo on Indonesia Buying 50 Boeing Jets
body: Trump recently announced that Indonesia would acquire 50 Boeing jets as he agreed to lower tariffs on Indonesian goods to 19 percent.

title: BI Cuts Rates for Second Time This Year, Signals Room for More Easing
body: Bank Indonesia cuts rates to 5.25% to support growth while keeping rupiah stable, marking its second cut this year as inflation stays low.

title: New US Tariffs Put Pressure on Indonesia’s $1.9B Seafood Exports
body: Indonesian fisheries exporters brace for tighter margins as the US hikes seafood tariffs to 19%, risking competitiveness in a $1.9B market.

title: Trump Eyes Indonesian Copper After Jakarta Strikes 19 Pct Tariff Deal
body: Trump revealed that this deal could enable the US to easily get its hand on Indonesian copper  — a critical component in electric vehicles.

body: Indonesia’s textile sector hails US tariff cut to 19%, boosting its edge over Vietnam and Bangladesh while helping protect 70,000 jobs.

title: Indonesia-US Trade Deal ‘Not Ideal,’ Economist Says
body: Indonesia’s new US trade deal is “not ideal” and may shrink its surplus as US goods enter tariff-free, economist Eko Listiyanto says.

title: JCI Gains as Rupiah Slips After Trump Lowers Tariffs on Indonesian Goods
body: JCI rises while the rupiah weakens after Trump cuts tariffs on Indonesian goods in exchange for US market access and Boeing jet purchases.

body: The Trump-era tariffs might not be overly concerning if Indonesia were treated equally with other countries.

body: Indonesia might lose its palm oil market to Malaysia if its fails to get a lower tariff in its negotiations with the Trump government.

title: Chinese Growth Slows Slightly to 5.2 Pct Amid Trade Wars with US

title: Indonesia May Scrap US Energy Imports if Tariffs Stay, Minister Says

body: The multi-entry Schengen visa allows holders to travel freely across 29 European countries without undergoing border checks.
